message.content:
cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.LG, cs.CY 

This paper is likely to belong to the Information Retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category as it addresses the problem of recommending hashtags for social media posts based on their content and context. It also involves natural language processing techniques, which are commonly used in the Computational Linguistics (cs.CL) sub-category. The methodology proposed in the paper involves training and testing on large datasets, which could fall under the sub-category of Scalable Computing (cs.SI). The use of word embeddings and similarity scores also suggests a connection to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category. Finally, the paper's focus on social media and user-generated content could potentially fall under the sub-category of Cybersecurity (cs.CY).
